Subject: CoSoSys EPP client upgrade + possible PC slowness/BSODs
Description: Could you take a look at below issue being report by our ICT Technical teams and help investigate whether the issue is related to a CoSoSys EPP client upgrade ? We should get on a quick call ASAP to discuss. [16:26] Gearoid Murphy PCs are so drastically slow that it is impossible to do anything with them when they have the issue. We have a couple of laptops blue screening and the message is mentioning a driver realted to Endpoint Protector.: So just in case the two issues (extreme slowness and BSODs) were related I tried booting from a build key and renaming the "C:Program FilesCoSoSysEndpoint Protector" folder on a laptop with the speed issue. After reboot issue disappeared. [16:53] Gearoid Murphy Also, on one of the blue screening laptops (Brian McDonagh's) I renamed the "C:Program FilesCoSoSysEndpoint Protector" same as above. After reboot blue screen occurred again. So I booted off build key again and renamed the driver file above (C:WindowsSystem32Driverscssdlp20.sys) to cssdlp20.sys.old. After reboot it didn't blue screen. It's been on for about 20 minutes with no apparent issue.
